video_description:
Twitter: http://twitter.com/booredatwork

Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/pages/Booredatwork/211909969459

Empireavenue: http://www.empireavenue.com/boored

The Lenovo IdePad K1 is the company's first Android powered Tablet, and is geared entertainment and the home consumer.  It's a 10.1" tablet with screen resolution of 1280x800, powered by a Terga 2 dual core processor, with 1GB of Ram and up to 64GB of internal storage. A 2MP front facing camera for video chat, a 5MP camera in the rear, micro SD card slot, Mini HDMI connector & a docking port.

The Lenovo IdeaPad K1 is an entertainment tablet, it comes in 4 colors at purchase, also has a slew of pre-installed apps; ie multitude of games, movie editor and more. That adds high entertainment value to the use of the Lenovo K1
title: lenovo IdeaPad K1 Tablet Ligthing Review

comments.text: Great review. Would love to see a head to﻿ head comparison between the K1 and the Transformer, Iconia and Xoom since they are all similar in specs and age and are all dropping in price fairly rapidly as newer Tegra 3 tablets (Transformer Prime) come out. Thanks!

comments.text:
The front facing camera is *not* VGA.
 
VGA resolution in webcams is 0.3 megapixels (or about 320 x x240 resolution) which is quite crappy. (Old computer video cards referred to VGA as 640 x 480)
 
The﻿﻿ Lenovo IdeaPad K1 has a 2 megapixel front camera! Far better than a 0.3 megapixel webcam that you said it had.
 
Just saying!
 
Good cursory review otherwise.
comments.author: PokerPirate
